definitions.definition: to pour a liquid in a very thin stream , or so that drops fall continuously .
examples: The doctor trickled some iodine on the wound.

definitions.definition: to flow in a very thin stream or drop continuously .
examples: Here the water just trickles along, but later it becomes a torrent.
The film was so bad that people trickled out of the cinema before its end.

main_definition: ( transitive ) to pour a liquid in a very thin stream , or so that drops fall continuously .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) to flow in a very thin stream or drop continuously .
( intransitive ) To move or roll slowly.
